intro: Castilleja ochracea, commonly known as the yellow milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a slender, hairy stem and produces small, oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Castilleja ochracea relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it an important component of its ecosystem.
